Name: Mahatma Gandhi
Disc: Leader of the Indian independence movement through non-violent civil disobedience. Known as the Father of the Nation, he led the Salt March and Quit India Movement.

Name: Subhas Chandra Bose
Disc: Revolutionary leader who formed the Indian National Army (INA) and fought against British rule. Known as Netaji, he believed in armed struggle for independence.

Name: Bhagat Singh
Disc: Revolutionary socialist and martyr who was executed at age 23. Famous for bombing the Central Legislative Assembly and his fearless attitude towards death for the country.

Name: Jawaharlal Nehru
Disc: First Prime Minister of independent India and key leader of the independence movement. Disciple of Gandhi and architect of modern India's democratic foundations.

Name: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
Disc: Known as the Iron Man of India, he played a crucial role in the political integration of India after independence. Key leader in the independence movement and first Deputy Prime Minister.

Name: Chandrashekhar Azad
Disc: Revolutionary who vowed never to be captured alive by the British. Leader of the Hindustan Republican Association and mentor to Bhagat Singh. Died fighting the British police.

Name: Rani Lakshmibai
Disc: Queen of Jhansi and one of the leading figures of the Indian Rebellion of 1857. Fought valiantly against the British East India Company and became a symbol of resistance.

Name: Mangal Pandey
Disc: Sepoy in the British East India Company who is credited with sparking the Indian Rebellion of 1857. His rebellion against the use of animal fat in cartridges became legendary.

Name: Ashfaqulla Khan
Disc: Revolutionary and close associate of Ram Prasad Bismil. Participated in the Kakori conspiracy and was executed by the British. Symbol of Hindu-Muslim unity in the freedom struggle.

Name: Ram Prasad Bismil
Disc: Revolutionary poet and leader of the Hindustan Republican Association. Led the famous Kakori train robbery and was executed by the British. Known for his patriotic poetry.

Name: Sarojini Naidu
Disc: Poet, political activist, and first woman Governor of an Indian state. Known as the Nightingale of India, she was a prominent leader in the Civil Disobedience Movement.

Name: Bal Gangadhar Tilak
Disc: Social reformer and freedom fighter known as Lokmanya Tilak. Promoted the slogan 'Swaraj is my birthright and I shall have it.' Founded festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi as nationalist tools.

Name: Lala Lajpat Rai
Disc: Freedom fighter and author known as Punjab Kesari (Lion of Punjab). Leader of the Lal Bal Pal trio and died from injuries sustained during a protest against the Simon Commission.

Name: Bipin Chandra Pal
Disc: Revolutionary writer and orator, part of the Lal Bal Pal trio. Advocated for Swadeshi movement and was one of the main architects of the revolutionary movement in Bengal.

Name: Khudiram Bose
Disc: One of the youngest revolutionaries executed by the British at age 18. Attempted to assassinate British officials and became a martyr inspiring many young Indians to join the freedom struggle.

Name: Annie Besant
Disc: British-born supporter of Indian self-rule, founder of the Home Rule League, and prominent theosophist who inspired many Indian leaders.

Name: Chittaranjan Das
Disc: Lawyer and nationalist leader, famous for defending Aurobindo Ghose in the Alipore Bomb Case and leading the Swaraj Party.

Name: Gopal Krishna Gokhale
Disc: Moderate nationalist leader and social reformer, mentor to Gandhi, and founder of the Servants of India Society.

Name: Dr. Rajendra Prasad
Disc: Prominent leader in the Indian National Congress and the first President of independent India.

Name: K. M. Munshi
Disc: Indian independence movement activist, writer, and founder of Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan.

Name: Deendayal Upadhyaya
Disc: Political thinker and leader of the Bharatiya Jana Sangh. Promoted Integral Humanism as an ideology.

Name: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar
Disc: Social reformer and architect of the Indian Constitution. Worked tirelessly for Dalit rights and social justice.

Name: Motilal Nehru
Disc: Prominent lawyer and politician, father of Jawaharlal Nehru, and leader in the Indian National Congress.

Name: Madam Bhikaiji Cama
Disc: Indian independence activist known for unfurling one of the first versions of the Indian flag in Germany.

Name: Chandra Shekhar Azad
Disc: Freedom fighter who reorganized the Hindustan Republican Association and fought British rule with armed resistance.

Name: Aruna Asaf Ali
Disc: Prominent woman freedom fighter known for hoisting the Indian National Congress flag during the Quit India Movement.

Name: Jyotirao Phule
Disc: Social reformer and anti-caste activist who worked to educate women and lower castes in 19th-century India.

Name: Annie Besant
Disc: Promoter of Indian self-rule and theosophist who inspired many Indian leaders.
